Amala Foods PLC
19 January 2026
Amala Foods Plc
(
"
Amala
" or the
"
Company")
Board Appointment
Amala Foods Plc (LON: DISH), is pleased to announce the appointment of Simon Grant-Rennick to the Board as an Executive Director with immediate effect.
Mr Grant Rennick is a graduate of the Camborne School of Mines. His expertise encompasses not only mining and minerals but also metals, agriculture and property. He has managed mining companies, both public and private, in Uganda and in Malawi; metal trading businesses in Bermuda and in the UK; was a co-founder of Industrial Mineral Finance House which provides consultancy services covering all aspects of the industrial minerals' sector, and established a property development business (since sold).
Simon maintains a number of Board and management roles varying from mining enterprises in Botswana, Malawi and Mexico; and in agribusinesses producing macadamia nuts, paprika and chilli, in sub-Saharan Africa. A complete list of Simon's current and previous directorships held over the past five years are listed below.
Simon's current directorships are:
Evrima Plc
,

,

His previous directorships over the past five years are:

UK Defence Industries Limited, Trans-Africa Energy Limited,
Rangemaster Precision Arms Limited,
Gunmakers Hall Limited,
Just Bee Honey Limited,
Hellenic Dynamics Plc.
Furthermore, the Company announces the resignation of Aidan Bishop as a Director of the Company, who will continue to assist the Board as required.
The Company has been making progress towards identifying a suitable transaction that may lead to a Reverse Takeover and will update the market in due course.
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION FOR THE PURPOSES OF ARTICLE 7 OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION EU 596/2014 ("MAR").

latest.title: Funding Updates
latest.content:
10 Oct 2025 08:00
RNS Number : 8488C
Amala Foods PLC
10 October 2025
Amala Foods Plc
(
"
Amala
" or the
"
Company")
Funding Updates
The board of Amala Foods Plc (LON: DISH) wishes to make this announcement to clarify the implication of some matters referenced in the Company's results for the year to 31 March 2025 ("Accounts"). The audit report in the Accounts included an adverse opinion due the outstanding nature of the Company's long term debt. The Company is currently relying on financing from a relatively new convertible loan funding agreement with a professional investor ("New Loan") detailed in the Accounts. The amount of the New Loan is £100,000 and drawdowns are to be made with agreement of the lender of the New Loan ("Investor") but the New Loan carries no interest and matures in August 2026. The New Loan is provided by Philip Reid who nominated his son, Sam Reid to the Board as Non-Executive Director.
The Company has various debt obligations that are currently due for repayment. The Company has entered into a new agreement with Riverfort, its largest creditor, on 8 October 2025 that has secured a standstill which prevents Riverfort requesting repayment of sums due to it before 7 October 2026. The Company intends to seek similar standstill agreements with the holders of the other convertible loan notes that the Company has issued. However, there is no guarantee that Company will be able to reach an agreement with these lenders to give the Company more time to repay them, if required.
The Company is currently working with the Investor to identify a target company or business which the Company could acquire in conjunction with seeking admission to the Equity Shares Commercial Company ("ESCC") category of the Official List. The Company is also working with the Investor to secure approximately £250,000 of further funding to meet part of the costs of any Initial Transaction. There can be no guarantee at this stage that the Company will be able to identify a suitable target, that the Company will be able to raise equity at a price acceptable to the Board or that the Company's shares will be admitted to the ESCC.
The Company continues to incur minimal overheads with the Directors continuing not to receive or accrue any form of remuneration which has been consistent over recent years.
If further funding is not available in the medium term and/or if debt holders were to request immediate repayment in cash then there is a material risk that the Board would seek to place the Company into an insolvency process which may lead to administration.
The Company will update the market in due course.
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION FOR THE PURPOSES OF ARTICLE 7 OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION EU 596/2014 ("MAR").
Enquiries:
Jonathan Morley-Kirk, Non-Executive Chairman
jm-k@hotmail.co.uk
Tel: +44
7797 775546

latest.title: Board Appointment
latest.content:
30 Sep 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 3814B
Amala Foods PLC
30 September 2025
Amala Foods Plc
(
"
Amala
" or the
"
Company")
Board Appointment
Amala Foods Plc (LON: DISH), is pleased to announce the appointment of Sam Reid to the Board as a Non-Executive Director, to be effective upon the restoration to trading of the Company's shares.
Mr. Sam Reid (British, age 37) is currently a principal of the Private Equity Division of Capital Plus Partners Ltd, a member of the London Stock Exchange. He is also Founder and CEO of SalvOcean Ltd, a leading specialised subsea engineering consultancy and specialised salvage project manager which now operates on a global scale.
Sam spent 5 years in Australia and worked with Stirling Andersen where he led the wealth management team managing a team of 12 working with some of Australia's largest Super Funds and Fund Managers, as well as managing a team working across banking, insurance and financial services.
Prior to joining Capital Plus Partners, Sam was with ACA Group - working with the professional services division looking to grow and increase commercial opportunities within the alternative investment sector. Key clients included large UK and US Hedge funds, family office and private equity houses.
His current directorships are: SalvOcean Ltd, Penguin Ventures Ltd
His previous directorships over the past five years are: BG Marketing Ltd, White Water Gold Ltd, Silverlink Ltd, Nautical ID Ltd, Capital IQ Ltd.
Furthermore, following the publication of the Annual Financial Report on 11 September 2025 and subsequent submission to the National Storage Mechanism in the required ESEF format, the Company is in contact with the Financial Conduct Authority with a view to achieve the restoration to trading of the Company's shares.
The Company will update the market in due course.
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION FOR THE PURPOSES OF ARTICLE 7 OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION EU 596/2014 ("MAR").
Enquiries:
Jonathan Morley-Kirk, Non-Executive Chairman
jmk@bluebirdmv.com
